availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Lindsey, Sr. (Marshall County DOC clergyman)

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, clergyman. North Carolina native. Married Tabitha Lindsey. Father of John S. Lindsey, Cornelius Lindsey, Allen K. Lindsey, Elisha Lindsey, Marlin Lindsey, and Noris Lindsey. Clergy of the Christian Church (Disciples of Christ) in Marshall County in 1850 and 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Unnamed District, p. 474 B; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Unnamed District, p. 108; Find A Grave, "Elder James William Lindsey (1804 - 1891)," Memorial #31227860, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=31227860 (accessed October 25, 2017).
